pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of #18220
2. This PR does the following: Migration of skulpt-dist from dependencies.json to package.json.
## Essential Checklist

- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

## Proof that changes are correct
Python code interaction before migration ---

https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/91013793/e0b9fbc1-4214-4048-b0ea-9eefea26931d


After migration ---

https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/91013793/feba3d02-e672-4408-9c0a-bfe9632c31d8





![Screenshot 2023-06-08 at 10 39 13 PM](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/91013793/af102c49-228b-414a-8ef1-7065c3d102a1)

', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 3, 15, 7, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1251125693, 'comment_body': 'they are within the node_modules, as we move the package to the package.json', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 3, 17, 3, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1253149498, 'comment_body': "@seanlip as per Praneeth's suggestion, should I use regex for checking the string pattern here?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 5, 13, 56, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1253149853, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 5, 13, 56, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1253234005, 'comment_body': 'Anything that is O(1) and easy for other devs to understand is fine with me.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 5, 14, 52, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1253290983, 'comment_body': 'I have pushed the changes with the regex expression. PTAL', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 5, 15, 33, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1253291209, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 5, 15, 34, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1253296491, 'comment_body': 'The "23" here is a "magic number" and folks won't know where it comes from. I suggest you define a constant for the 'git+...' string and use len() here when referencing it.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 5, 15, 38, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1253320510, 'comment_body': 'instead of this, I used `startswith` function which is more readable and easy to understand. thanks!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 5, 15, 56, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1254086842, 'comment_body': "Can you modify `GIT_COMMIT_HASH_REGEX` so you can check `git+https://github.com/' too?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 6, 8, 6, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'gp201', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1254681643, 'comment_body': '@gp201 will that be required? as we are checking this `git+https://github.com/` within the elif condition too?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 6, 16, 39, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1254799273, 'comment_body': 'Could we just collapse it into just one condition?

Modify the regex just how Praneeth suggested and use it as a condition in elif?
`elif re.search(GIT_COMMIT_HASH_REGEX, lib_version):`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 6, 18, 43, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'aasiffaizal', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1256456403, 'comment_body': 'done @aasiffaizal @gp201 ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 7, 20, 48, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1257326420, 'comment_body': "Do we need both the imports for this to function? If yes, then please move these into the file: core/templates/third-party-imports/skulpt.import.ts which was deleted in this PR. The reason for doing so is to make sure that when we create a new page and we want to use skulpt-dist, we don't worry about what needs to imported and we can just import the file.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 8, 18, 24, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'srijanreddy98', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1257392040, 'comment_body': '@srijanreddy98 thanks for suggesting. updated PTAL!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 9, 0, 51, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of #18220
2. This PR does the following: Migrated diff-match-patch package from dependencies.json to package.json
3. (For bug-fixing PRs only) The original bug occurred because: [Explain what
   the cause of the bug was, and which PR introduced it]

## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The **PR title** starts with "Fix #bugnum: " or "Fix part of #bugnum: ...",
followed by a short, clear summary of the changes.
- [x] I have followed the [instructions for making a code change](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request).
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed on my local machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
- [x] I have assigned the correct reviewers to this PR (or will leave a
comment with the phrase "@{{reviewer_username}} PTAL" if I don't have
permissions to assign reviewers directly).

## Proof that changes are correct

https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/91013793/13d58e0e-2061-4c69-92b8-ae03400efa4a
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 1270637088, 'comment_body': "Why does this change to `true`? In the screen recording, this line doesn't look highlighted", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 21, 12, 46, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1270738931, 'comment_body': 'I forgot to update the PR desc recording.. from the new package we are using from NPM, it is also highlighting the just parent element of the changed content. updated the screen recording', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 21, 14, 25, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1270769051, 'comment_body': 'Is this change intended?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 21, 14, 52, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'lkbhitesh07', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1270788016, 'comment_body': 'Ahh okay, it looks like the NPM package is just creating a few, larger changed "chunks" than before (where it created more, smaller chunks). I think that\'s fine', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 21, 15, 7, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1270788243, 'comment_body': 'this is fine. after I added checksums in the requirements file, so many other developers were pushing this change into their PRs, so pushing it to develop from here will fix it', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 21, 15, 7, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: [GSoC'23] M1.3.1 - Added checksums for requirements.txt and requirements_dev.txt
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of #18255 
2. This PR does the following: Added checksums within the requirements.txt and requirements_dev.txt


## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The **PR title** starts with "Fix #bugnum: " or "Fix part of #bugnum: ...",
followed by a short, clear summary of the changes.
- [x] I have followed the [instructions for making a code change](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request).
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed on my local machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
- [x] I have assigned the correct reviewers to this PR (or will leave a
comment with the phrase "@{{reviewer_username}} PTAL" if I don't have
permissions to assign reviewers directly).


## Testing doc (for PRs with Beam jobs that modify production server data)

<!--
If this PR affects production server data, please follow
[these instructions](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Testing-jobs-and-other-features-on-production#submitting-a-pr-with-a-new-job-or-feature-that-requires-third-party-api)
and link to the job request doc here.

Otherwise, please delete this section.
-->

## Proof that changes are correct

<!--
Add videos/screenshots of the user-facing interface to demonstrate that the changes
made in this PR work correctly. If this PR is for a developer-facing feature,
provide the videos/screenshots of developer-facing interface.

Please also include videos/screenshots of the developer tools
browser console, so that we can be sure that there are no console errors.

The above should be done for all PRs, including short ones (e.g. a single-line change).
However, if the changes in your PRs are autogenerated via a script and you cannot
provide proof for the changes then please leave a comment "No proof of changes
needed because {{Reason}}" and remove all the sections below.
-->

#### Proof of changes on desktop with slow/throttled network

<!--
Make sure to properly verify that everything works correctly, and that there are
no weird UI mistakes or other problems. Also, if there are any newly added fields,
try to fill them out and test that different inputs are correctly accepted/rejected.

Throttle the network (to 3G) using the browser Developer Tools (see references below).
There should be no performance or UI issues while the network is slow.

References:
 - Chrome: https://css-tricks.com/throttling-the-network/
 - Firefox: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Network_Monitor/Throttling
-->

#### Proof of changes on mobile phone

<!--
In some cases this is not needed (e.g. for pages that we do not expect to
support mobile phones, or for backend-only features).

Feel free to use the Developer Tools emulator for this.

References:
 - Chrome: https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/device-mode/
 - Firefox: https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/devtools-user/index.html#responsive-design-mode
-->

#### Proof of changes in Arabic language

<!--
If the PR changes the UI, make sure to add screenshots with the site
language set to Arabic as well (we use Arabic as it is a language written from right to left).
-->

## PR Pointers

- Never force push! If you do, your PR will be closed.
- Make sure your PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays.
- Some e2e tests are flaky, and can fail for reasons unrelated to your PR. We are working on fixing this, but in the meantime, if you need to restart the tests, please check the ["If your build fails" wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/If-CI-checks-fail-on-your-PR).
- See the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia's-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers) for what code owners will expect.
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 1264356971, 'comment_body': 'Can we add a small comment explaining why we need this substitution in the requirements.txt file? Let me know if you think it is not needed, we can discuss it.

Thanks', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 8, 4, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'lkbhitesh07', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264384970, 'comment_body': 'we need to remove the generated hashes within the requirements.txt before parsing it to pkg_resources - 
pkg_resources expects requirements to be specified per PEP 508 ([doc](https://setuptools.pypa.io/en/latest/pkg_resources.html#requirements-parsing)), which does not include the â€“hashes command-line argument that we use for pip.

please let me know to include this info in the `setup.py`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 11, 0, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264389414, 'comment_body': 'I think it will be good to add a small comment regarding this.
Thanks', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 11, 36, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'lkbhitesh07', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264390908, 'comment_body': 'done @lkbhitesh07 Thanks!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 11, 45, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264428990, 'comment_body': 'Can we keep `pip-sync` here? `pip install` and `pip-sync` are slightly different in that `pip-sync` will also uninstall any installed packages that are not in the requirements file, which ensures that the dev environment is always exactly what's reflected in the requirements file.

Any arg that can be passed to `pip install` can be passed to `pip-sync` like this:

`pip-sync requirements.txt --pip-args "--no-cache-dir --no-deps"`

So I think you can do something like this:

`['pip-sync', COMPILED_REQUIREMENTS_DEV_FILE_PATH, '--pip-args', '--require-hashes --no-deps'],`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 14, 6, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264433406, 'comment_body': "```suggestion
            if not line or line.startswith('#') or line.startswith('--hash='):
```

Just to make it clearer what's being excluded with the second `line.startswith`", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 14, 10, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264438476, 'comment_body': 'Please make the second part of this regex (`--hash=sha256:[a-zA-Z0-9]+`) match only complete lines by using `^` and `$`, which refer to the start and end of a line, respectively. I think you want something like this for the second part of the regex:

`^\s*--hash=sha256:[a-zA-Z0-9]+$| \\$` (like what you have in `setup.py`)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 14, 17, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264440546, 'comment_body': "I don't think this comment is correct. This isn't a test that will be removed after complete type annotation.

What type error are you getting without this ignore? From the `parse_requirements` code, it looks like a string is definitely an allowed input: https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/blob/6083e18f4afc40316c0112134c205c336afbcdfd/pkg_resources/__init__.py#L3158", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 14, 25, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264559773, 'comment_body': "we are skipping the via dependencies that are started with '#', and skipping the hashes that starts with '--hash'.
so changing the condition to `--hash=`", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 20, 52, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264560792, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 21, 4, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264561699, 'comment_body': 'yes done, both regex can be same', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 21, 15, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264562093, 'comment_body': 'this was the error I was facing. PTAL
https://github.com/oppia/oppia/actions/runs/5556382341/jobs/10148824960', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 21, 18, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264563926, 'comment_body': 'For anyone reading this in the future, the error was `setup.py:48: error: Argument 1 to "parse_requirements" has incompatible type "str"; expected "TextIO"  [arg-type]`. This means that mypy thinks `pkg_resources.parse_requirements` only takes TextIO, even though its documentation clearly says that `str` is a valid type. Therefore, @shivkant5 I agree with adding a mypy ignore here like you already did. Please just update the comment to explain that the type hint on `pkg_resources.parse_requirements` is wrong', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 21, 39, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264580538, 'comment_body': 'changed the comment to have the actual prob. thanks!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 22, 46, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: [GSoC'23] M1.3.2 - #18255 Initial docker setup for dev server
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of #18255
2. This PR does the following: set-up initial docker setup for the development server. Note, this PR does not contains the flags functionality and the local tests running within the docker setup.

## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The **PR title** starts with "Fix #bugnum: " or "Fix part of #bugnum: ...",
followed by a short, clear summary of the changes.
- [x] I have followed the [instructions for making a code change](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request).
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed on my local machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
- [x] I have assigned the correct reviewers to this PR (or will leave a
comment with the phrase "@{{reviewer_username}} PTAL" if I don't have
permissions to assign reviewers directly).


## Testing doc (for PRs with Beam jobs that modify production server data)

<!--
If this PR affects production server data, please follow
[these instructions](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Testing-jobs-and-other-features-on-production#submitting-a-pr-with-a-new-job-or-feature-that-requires-third-party-api)
and link to the job request doc here.

Otherwise, please delete this section.
-->

## Proof that changes are correct

<!--
Add videos/screenshots of the user-facing interface to demonstrate that the changes
made in this PR work correctly. If this PR is for a developer-facing feature,
provide the videos/screenshots of developer-facing interface.

Please also include videos/screenshots of the developer tools
browser console, so that we can be sure that there are no console errors.

The above should be done for all PRs, including short ones (e.g. a single-line change).
However, if the changes in your PRs are autogenerated via a script and you cannot
provide proof for the changes then please leave a comment "No proof of changes
needed because {{Reason}}" and remove all the sections below.
-->

#### Proof of changes on desktop with slow/throttled network

<!--
Make sure to properly verify that everything works correctly, and that there are
no weird UI mistakes or other problems. Also, if there are any newly added fields,
try to fill them out and test that different inputs are correctly accepted/rejected.

Throttle the network (to 3G) using the browser Developer Tools (see references below).
There should be no performance or UI issues while the network is slow.

References:
 - Chrome: https://css-tricks.com/throttling-the-network/
 - Firefox: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Network_Monitor/Throttling
-->

#### Proof of changes on mobile phone

<!--
In some cases this is not needed (e.g. for pages that we do not expect to
support mobile phones, or for backend-only features).

Feel free to use the Developer Tools emulator for this.

References:
 - Chrome: https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/device-mode/
 - Firefox: https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/devtools-user/index.html#responsive-design-mode
-->

#### Proof of changes in Arabic language

<!--
If the PR changes the UI, make sure to add screenshots with the site
language set to Arabic as well (we use Arabic as it is a language written from right to left).
-->

## PR Pointers

- Never force push! If you do, your PR will be closed.
- Make sure your PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays.
- Some e2e tests are flaky, and can fail for reasons unrelated to your PR. We are working on fixing this, but in the meantime, if you need to restart the tests, please check the ["If your build fails" wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/If-CI-checks-fail-on-your-PR).
- See the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia's-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers) for what code owners will expect.

## To be addressed at the end

https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/18578#discussion_r1257339430
https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/18578#discussion_r1257471981
https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/18578#discussion_r1256222357
https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/18578#discussion_r1249565143

the reason is to have an optimised docker setup that takes least possible time to start. if we start all the containers at the same time, then there might be some resources issues as all the services are started in parallel. so I decided to have 2 stages in which services will start (this seems the most optimised way. please add your suggestions to improve more). so in stage1, webpack and angular-build (the most resource-taking services) are started, then in the stage 2, when the webpack and ng-build are completed with their build, rest other services are started.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 7, 20, 55, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1256465315, 'comment_body': 'please refer [here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/18578/files#r1251204798), already answered this. thanks!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 7, 20, 56, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1256471530, 'comment_body': 'sure, added this everywhere!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 7, 21, 0, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1256498500, 'comment_body': 'yes, we require this when accessing any ES services from its APIs. also used within the healthcheck', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 7, 21, 26, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1256499500, 'comment_body': '> Where are we running this command

thanks', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 10, 22, 37, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1258977846, 'comment_body': 'removed, thanks!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 10, 22, 38, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1258980616, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 10, 22, 43, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1258984677, 'comment_body': 'yes, as per our discussion over Chat, this env variable is specifically required so that the server runs properly on macOS (silicon chip) in which we require to specifically set the platform for the built images where the server will  be running. refer to the first answer [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/71040681/qemu-x86-64-could-not-open-lib64-ld-linux-x86-64-so-2-no-such-file-or-direc) basically we are defining the infrastructure as code for the containers where the server will be running.


also, note that this platform flag specified the platform for the built output i.e the images/containers where our server will be running. refer [here](https://docs.docker.com/build/building/multi-platform/#:~:text=When%20you%20invoke%20a%20build,can%20specify%20multiple%20platforms%20together.)
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 10, 22, 50, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1258985636, 'comment_body': 'refer to my answer [here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/18578/files#r1258984677)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 10, 22, 52, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1258988218, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 10, 22, 57, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1260028863, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 11, 17, 11, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1260028994, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 11, 17, 11, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1260138778, 'comment_body': 'as per discussion with @U8NWXD, the build.py specifically in dev_mode is used to generate `third_party/generated` dir which is a unified code for the third_party packages that are being downloaded using `dependencies.json`. as we are moving forward with the depedencies.json deprecation, there will not be any addition of the packages in this json file. so we can add this step in the dockerfile so it gets in the cache.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 11, 18, 44, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1260147386, 'comment_body': "Thanks for looking into it in detail, @shivkant5 

If it's just dealing with dependencies.json libs, can we move those specific steps to `install_dependencies_json_packages.py`, so that we only have to use this single/temporary/independent file for the image and it can be easily removed when needed? ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 11, 18, 49, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1260155812, 'comment_body': 'but this is not just we are doing this thing only when in dev_mode. we clean the existing generated files, build some hashes files.
when in prod_mode, minify the codebase, generate backend prod_files and other prod related files, generate app.yml file specific for prod
within minify flag (this flag is used internally within the scripts), we minify the third_party_libs.

so it seems we cannot move this toi install_dependencies_json file.
what I want to ask from you is, we clean the setup and re-generate the `thirdparty/generated` dir, means we are refreshing it everytime we start the server. what do you say, should we add this in the compose service command? so that it get refreshed everytime we start the server. I assume it wont take more than 30-40secs to regenerate', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 11, 18, 58, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1260162855, 'comment_body': "> can you please list out the thing for which we are using build.py?

This is why I'm asking to create a list. It will be hard to decide otherwise.

> . we clean the existing generated files

This is not needed if we are doing it in the image layer.

> build some hashes files.

Do we need to create this before starting the server with new files? i.e, part of entry point?

> when in prod_mode, minify the codebase, generate backend prod_files and other prod related files, generate app.yml file specific for prod
within minify flag (this flag is used internally within the scripts), we minify the third_party_libs.

So it looks like we can't use most of the steps in build.py  during image creation phase as it depends on local repo.


> so it seems we cannot move this toi install_dependencies_json file.

Reading the above comment, I feel like we should move the dependencies.json related things to the install_dependencies_json.py file as will help us move the static part of build.py to Dockerfile.

> 
> we clean the setup and re-generate the thirdparty/generated dir, means we are refreshing it everytime we start the server. what do you say, should we add this in the compose service command? so that it get refreshed everytime we start the server. I assume it wont take more than 30-40secs to regenerate

I would suggest leaving the `third_party/generated` part in the Dockerfile itself via `install_dependencies_json.py` file and move other dynamic steps to entrypoint.sh. wdyt? 

", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 11, 19, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1260210325, 'comment_body': "> This is why I'm asking to create a list. It will be hard to decide otherwise.

- in dev_mode 
    1. clean generated files 
    1. re-generate these third party files 
    1. generate some hashes file. 
        - this is for dev mode only when no flag is passed. (when passing prod_env I am thinking to add this in compose service command as it will generate the prod artifacts when prod env flag passed)

- in prod_mode 
    1. clean 
    2. re-generate these third party files 
    3. modify the constants in constant files as per the flag we pass. 
    4. minify 3rd party list 
    5. generate hashes 
    6. generate app.yml for production 
    7. generate build directories for prod 
    8. generate and save hashes acc to the prod build artifacts

> Do we need to create this before starting the server with new files? i.e, part of entry point?

yes the hashes files need to be created before the server is up

> So it looks like we can't use most of the steps in build.py during image creation phase as it depends on local repo.

yes, we need to use them while starting the container

> I would suggest leaving the third_party/generated part in the Dockerfile itself via install_dependencies_json.py file and move other dynamic steps to entrypoint.sh. wdyt?

I am okay with this, but one point I need to clarify, we will create the third_party/generated folder within the `install_dependencies_json_packages`, and the dynamic part will be moved to the compose entrypoint. but the problem is that the build.py will first execute the clean which will delete all the generated file (which we generate within the image building step and we cannot remove this step). so this will be clearing the generated dirs", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 11, 19, 51, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1260228080, 'comment_body': "> in dev_mode: clean generated files

This is not needed as files are generated in an empty image container.

> In dev mode: re-generate these third party files

Maybe move this to `install_dependencies_json_packages`.

> In dev mode: generate some hashes file.

I think it's `{}` for dev_mode, so through Dockerfile create a file with `{}` content. `RUN echo '{}' > hashes.json`

In the entrypoint.sh for prod env do what's needed.

> but the problem is that the build.py will first execute the clean which will delete all the generated file (which we generate within the image building step and we cannot remove this step). so this will be clearing the generated dirs

I'm assuming we will not use build.py (even if we do we can avoid cleaning and generating dependencies.json related files during entrypoint.). Is that helpful?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 11, 20, 9, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1260278584, 'comment_body': "Let's do this:
```
- Dockerfile:
    - Generates `third_party/generated` folder
    - Creates empty `{}` hashes.json
- entrypoint.sh
    - Modify constant
    - if prod_mode: run build.py to do all the prod related things.
```

This structure will help us (1) simplify the dev_mode and make it faster to start devserver (2) Helps us avoid the OPPIA_IS_DOCKERISED flag in build.py

Let me know if this sounds good to you?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 11, 21, 1, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1262004102, 'comment_body': 'Test whether this is needed on ubuntu image?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 13, 5, 32, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1262004412, 'comment_body': 'As per our discussion, check whether 0.0.0.0 is needed or localhost will work? pr_title: [GSoC'23] M1.3.3 - Flags implementation in docker setup
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of #18255 
2. This PR does the following: Added all working flags within the Docker setup
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 1264581787, 'comment_body': 'please use a bash file wherever you are using `sh -c`. This file already has a lot, so better move the "moveable" parts to other files. Also, that will allow to write a clean bash script with indented if-else.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 15, 23, 1, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264596816, 'comment_body': 'Is there some text missing here? There's nothing after "Specifically:"

Also, to me "permanently" suggests that if a dev changes a variable to true and then back to false, the flag will stay enabled. Is that the case, or do you just mean that the flag will be enabled even if not passed on the command line?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 16, 2, 41, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264596865, 'comment_body': 'Can you indent these lines so the output is easier to read?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 16, 2, 43, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264649561, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 16, 9, 37, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264650255, 'comment_body': 'fixed the comments.
for the second ques --
the flag will be enabled even if it is not passed in the make command from CLI (if dev changes any variable to true), otherwise no permanent effect if they set them back to false.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 16, 9, 42, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1264689748, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
# Changing the variables (which are flags for running the local development server) to true will enable the flag to your `make run-devserver` command even if you do not explicitly pass the flag.
```

(IIRC you agreed with this script after discussion in a meet)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 20, 21, 12, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1269974728, 'comment_body': 'firebase doesnt import user data when `save_datastore` if we use `if-else` condition here. The reason is --
this `/app/firebase_emulator_cache` is a named vol present within the docker, but when we pass it within if-else then before the command execution it tries to find that path and then unable to locate it as present within docker named volume. so just for firebase entrypoint script, we need to have this structure', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 20, 21, 15, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1269975821, 'comment_body': 'if we set it from env variable, then it will be applicable always! we need this flag just when we are in `prod_env`. we cannot have this flag always because it allocates 8192 MB to the webpack compiler which is too bad in terms of resource allocation is we pass this always using env variables', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 20, 21, 16, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1270002085, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 20, 21, 56, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1270003038, 'comment_body': 'either we need to write bash or give permission to the bash script within the entrypoint command. like --
`bash {{PATH}}`  or `chmod +x {{PATH}} && {{PATH}}`
so I feel `bash {{PATH}}` is more clearer to use', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 20, 21, 58, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: [GSoC'23] M1.5 - Oppia Docker setup Installation Guide
pr_body:
This PR contains the Installation Guide for the Dockerized Oppia development server, including information regarding all the make commands.
Refer - https://github.com/oppia/oppia/issues/18257
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 1266680764, 'comment_body': 'please remove this file', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 18, 12, 12, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1266682025, 'comment_body': 'The wiki automatically generates a title based on the filename (in this case it'll be "Installing Oppia Docker"), so you don't need this', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 18, 12, 14, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1266684617, 'comment_body': 'I think we should be clearer about what the difference is between the installation approaches from the developer's perspective. How about we label the Python setup as "standard" and the Docker setup as "experimental"? Then once we're sure the Docker setup is stable, we can make it "standard".', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 18, 12, 16, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1266772971, 'comment_body': 'These should be links to the relevant sections', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 18, 13, 26, 5, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1266779375, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
> NOTE: The above step needs to be followed only once. The next time you want to run Oppia, you can directly start from the next section, i.e. by executing simple `make` commands from the root directory of the cloned Oppia repository.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 18, 13, 30, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1266780399, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
2. **Build Oppia for the First Time**: Run the following command to build Oppia for the first time. This step downloads all the necessary third-party libraries, python dependencies, and the other services required for the Oppia development server, which may take approximately 15-20 minutes (varies according to the network connection speed).
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 18, 13, 31, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1266781875, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
- `save_datastore`: This flag prevents clearing of the datastore upon shutting down the development server.

- `disable_host_checking`: Disables host checking so that the dev server can be accessed by any device on the same network using the host device's IP address. DO NOT use this flag if you're running on an untrusted network.
```

Avoid starting these descriptions with "it". You can use "This flag" instead or just leave "it" out entirely. ditto elsewhere', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 18, 13, 35, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1266786760, 'comment_body': '```suggestion

pr_title: [GSoC'23] - M1.4.1 - Migrating Lint checks to work under Docker setup
pr_body:
## Overview

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of #18256 
2. This PR does the following: Lints checks to work under Docker setup

## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The **PR title** starts with "Fix #bugnum: " or "Fix part of #bugnum: ...",
followed by a short, clear summary of the changes.
- [x] I have followed the [instructions for making a code change](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request).
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed on my local machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
- [x] I have assigned the correct reviewers to this PR (or will leave a
comment with the phrase "@{{reviewer_username}} PTAL" if I don't have
permissions to assign reviewers directly).


## Testing doc (for PRs with Beam jobs that modify production server data)

<!--
If this PR affects production server data, please follow
[these instructions](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Testing-jobs-and-other-features-on-production#submitting-a-pr-with-a-new-job-or-feature-that-requires-third-party-api)
and link to the job request doc here.

Otherwise, please delete this section.
-->

## Proof that changes are correct

<!--
Add videos/screenshots of the user-facing interface to demonstrate that the changes
made in this PR work correctly. If this PR is for a developer-facing feature,
provide the videos/screenshots of developer-facing interface.

Please also include videos/screenshots of the developer tools
browser console, so that we can be sure that there are no console errors.

The above should be done for all PRs, including short ones (e.g. a single-line change).
However, if the changes in your PRs are autogenerated via a script and you cannot
provide proof for the changes then please leave a comment "No proof of changes
needed because {{Reason}}" and remove all the sections below.
-->

#### Proof of changes on desktop with slow/throttled network

<!--
Make sure to properly verify that everything works correctly, and that there are
no weird UI mistakes or other problems. Also, if there are any newly added fields,
try to fill them out and test that different inputs are correctly accepted/rejected.

Throttle the network (to 3G) using the browser Developer Tools (see references below).
There should be no performance or UI issues while the network is slow.

References:
 - Chrome: https://css-tricks.com/throttling-the-network/
 - Firefox: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Network_Monitor/Throttling
-->

#### Proof of changes on mobile phone

<!--
In some cases this is not needed (e.g. for pages that we do not expect to
support mobile phones, or for backend-only features).

Feel free to use the Developer Tools emulator for this.

References:
 - Chrome: https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/device-mode/
 - Firefox: https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/devtools-user/index.html#responsive-design-mode
-->

#### Proof of changes in Arabic language

<!--
If the PR changes the UI, make sure to add screenshots with the site
language set to Arabic as well (we use Arabic as it is a language written from right to left).
-->

## PR Pointers

- Never force push! If you do, your PR will be closed.
- Make sure your PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays.
- Some e2e tests are flaky, and can fail for reasons unrelated to your PR. We are working on fixing this, but in the meantime, if you need to restart the tests, please check the ["If your build fails" wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/If-CI-checks-fail-on-your-PR).
- See the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia's-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers) for what code owners will expect.
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 1277716623, 'comment_body': "Why do we need to run the dev-server to run pre-commit linter? Can't we run the backend-related lint checks on the backend image as a entry-point?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 28, 15, 45, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1277920050, 'comment_body': "the test needs python3.8 env that is within the backend dockerfile.

> Can't we run the backend-related lint checks on the backend image as a entry-point?

I am unable to understand running the lint checks as the entrypoint for backend image. what if dev wants to run the  checks manually sometime? like we run `python -m scripts.linters.pre_commit_linter` now", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 28, 17, 56, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1278316191, 'comment_body': 'they can run it manually similar to how we will run it in the CI, that should be fine, right?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 29, 15, 54, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1278316457, 'comment_body': 'I have few question about this structure:

1. Why do we need to run Google app engine server for lint checks?
2. Why do we need to run webpack, angular-build container to run lint checks?

I hope this helps you understand my concerns. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 29, 15, 58, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1278381892, 'comment_body': "> they can run it manually similar to how we will run it in the CI, that should be fine, right?

yes.

> Why do we need to run Google app engine server for lint checks?

since we require python3.8 env to run tests, and we have python3.8 env in backend dockerfile + other packages we require in the python scripts are downloaded in the backend dockerfile + the volumes mapping for the oppia root dir in the dev-server enables lint checks to work properly.

> Why do we need to run webpack, angular-build container to run lint checks?

we don't require any server for the lint checks. its just we want to have python3.8 env and other packages required (present in the backend dockerfile)", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 29, 19, 50, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1278421052, 'comment_body': "> since we require python3.8 env to run tests, and we have python3.8 env in backend dockerfile + other packages we require in the python scripts are downloaded in the backend dockerfile + the volumes mapping for the oppia root dir in the dev-server enables lint checks to work properly.

But it still doesn't explain why we need to run the server.

> we don't require any server for the lint checks. its just we want to have python3.8 env and other packages required (present in the backend dockerfile)

I understand you need python3.8 but it doesn't explain why we need to run so many services (7 or 8) to run lint checks.

7-8 services including redis, elasticsearch, firebase, webpack etc.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 29, 21, 17, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1278438890, 'comment_body': "yes, we just need python3.8 env and other packages required which are present within the backend dockerfile, so we need to run a service that uses this backend dockerfile, and then run the command within that service. I choose dev-server service because we also need the volume mapping of oppia root dir or other generated files which dev-server have (datastore service do not have that vol mapping as it is not required for the datastore service).

yes, we don't need other services to be active for the lint checks, but since we start the devserver service, then all other services are started because dev-service depends on all other services", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 29, 21, 51, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1278447521, 'comment_body': "> yes, we don't need other services to be active for the lint checks, but since we start the devserver service, then all other services are started because dev-service depends on all other services

It doesn't make sense to run 7 unwanted services to run lint checks, can we do it without running any unwanted service? Do you know any organization/project which follows this pattern? Is this the expected pattern to run the lint check with the docker project in other communities? ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 29, 22, 47, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1279749307, 'comment_body': 'after taking some reference from other orgs and discussion with @gp201, now only 1 container is started to provide the required env and the volume mapping. also, I override the entrypoint command to the command to run the lint check which seems to be the correct way to run the lint checks under docker setup. PTAL @DubeySandeep ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 31, 19, 0, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1302533353, 'comment_body': '@U8NWXD I need to discuss about how we will be handling flags for the local tests wrapped up using make commands.
on taking reference from nodejs repo --  refer [here](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/main/Makefile#L319), the plan is to pass the flags as a string, and then internally I will append this string within the python command we are executing.
The make commands will look like --
`make run_tests.lints` (normal command)
`make run_tests.lints flags="--path Makefile"` (adding flag as a string)

how we handle 2 flags at a time ---
`make run_tests.backend flags="--verbose --generate_coverage_report"`

![image](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/91013793/2d0963fa-0740-412a-bc4f-513a9ec7069a)



and @gp201 also agrees on this. whats your opinion @U8NWXD ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 23, 6, 20, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1308813898, 'comment_body': "@Shivkant-Chauhan Can't we do it similarly to how we are handling flags for test targets?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 29, 13, 23, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1313970188, 'comment_body': '"test targets"
I think you are discussing about what you added for the backend tests initially in the Makefile. please take a look to [this](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pvHjw-hFacNIr6z7oDaZ6a2atf0fvbaggpPbRhPkqqo/edit?disco=AAAA2sB_PEo), we have several issues while doing that because bash understands the `--` as the make command args/option', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 2, 19, 57, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1323809042, 'comment_body': 'Hey @DubeySandeep @U8NWXD, upon discussion with @seanlip, he is okay with passing the flags as a string to the python command using `PYTHON_ARGS` as the argument for the make command. This will be the same for all the local tests that have flags or optional args for the python command.
We can change it to either with separate args for each flag that the python command supports (that @U8NWXD earlier suggested) post-GSoC ends, after discussing it properly according to the requirements.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 13, 1, 11, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1328245520, 'comment_body': 'This is fine for now, but I highly recommend running js/ts-related (Eslint) checks on front-end services. 

Also, in the future: Create x-base-backend services which have the core image and no entrypoint and create the child containers with entry-point using it. (Ditto for frontend containers)

Can you please add these to tracking issues?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 18, 4, 49, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1328245959, 'comment_body': 'Ideally, we are not planning to populate all the scripts with this flag, so as a tracking task remove this flag once running checks in a separate container.  ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 18, 4, 51, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1329153686, 'comment_body': 'sure, on permenantly moving to Docker setup, the use of this check will be removed.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 18, 18, 52, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1329155313, 'comment_body': 'thanks! added this in the https://github.com/oppia/oppia/issues/18638', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 18, 18, 54, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: [GSoC'23] - M1.4.2 - migrating local tests under docker
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of #18256
2. This PR does the following: added all the local tests to work under Docker setup using simple make commands.

## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The **PR title** starts with "Fix #bugnum: " or "Fix part of #bugnum: ...",
followed by a short, clear summary of the changes.
- [x] I have followed the [instructions for making a code change](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request).
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed on my local machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
- [x] I have assigned the correct reviewers to this PR (or will leave a
comment with the phrase "@{{reviewer_username}} PTAL" if I don't have
permissions to assign reviewers directly).

.

pr_title: [GSoC'23] - M1.4.2 - Added make command for lighthouse tests, added flags in e2e tests
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of https://github.com/oppia/oppia/issues/18256
2. This PR does the following: Added make command for running the lighthouse tests, list flags for the acceptance, e2e and lighthouse tests, added flags in e2e make command

## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The **PR title** starts with "Fix #bugnum: " or "Fix part of #bugnum: ...",
followed by a short, clear summary of the changes.
- [x] I have followed the [instructions for making a code change](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request).
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed on my local machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
- [x] My PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide).
- [x] I have assigned the correct reviewers to this PR (or will leave a
comment with the phrase "@{{reviewer_username}} PTAL" if I don't have
permissions to assign reviewers directly).

## Testing doc (for PRs with Beam jobs that modify production server data)

<!--
If this PR affects production server data, please follow
[these instructions](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Testing-jobs-and-other-features-on-production#submitting-a-pr-with-a-new-job-or-feature-that-requires-third-party-api)
and link to the job request doc here.

Otherwise, please delete this section.
-->
- [ ] A testing doc has been written: ... (ADD LINK) ...
- [ ] _(To be confirmed by the server admin)_ All jobs in this PR have been verified on a live server, and the PR is safe to merge.


## Proof that changes are correct

<!--
Add videos/screenshots of the user-facing interface to demonstrate that the changes
made in this PR work correctly. If this PR is for a developer-facing feature,
provide the videos/screenshots of developer-facing interface. Please also include
videos/screenshots of the developer tools browser console, so that we can be
sure that there are no console errors.

When you make updates to the PR, please update these videos/screenshots as well.
You can drop videos/screenshots from previous versions of the PR.

The above should be done for all PRs, including short ones (e.g. a single-line change).
However, if the changes in your PRs are autogenerated via a script and you cannot
provide proof for the changes then please leave a comment "No proof of changes
needed because {{Reason}}" and remove all the sections below.
-->

#### Proof of changes on desktop with slow/throttled network

<!--
Make sure to properly verify that everything works correctly, and that there are
no weird UI mistakes or other problems. Also, if there are any newly added fields,
try to fill them out and test that different inputs are correctly accepted/rejected.

Throttle the network (to 3G) using the browser Developer Tools (see references below).
There should be no performance or UI issues while the network is slow.

References:
 - Chrome: https://css-tricks.com/throttling-the-network/
 - Firefox: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Network_Monitor/Throttling
-->

#### Proof of changes on mobile phone

<!--
In some cases this is not needed (e.g. for pages that we do not expect to
support mobile phones, or for backend-only features).

Feel free to use the Developer Tools emulator for this.

References:
 - Chrome: https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/device-mode/
 - Firefox: https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/devtools-user/index.html#responsive-design-mode
-->

#### Proof of changes in Arabic language

<!--
If the PR changes the UI, make sure to add screenshots with the site
language set to Arabic as well (we use Arabic as it is a language written from right to left).
-->

## PR Pointers

- Never force push! If you do, your PR will be closed.
- To reply to reviewers, follow these instructions: https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request#step-5-address-review-comments-until-all-reviewers-approve
- Some e2e tests are flaky, and can fail for reasons unrelated to your PR. We are working on fixing this, but in the meantime, if you need to restart the tests, please check the ["If your build fails" wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/If-CI-checks-fail-on-your-PR).
- See the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia's-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers) for what code owners will expect.

pr_title: [GSoC'23] - M2.2 - Migrating CI jobs under docker
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of #18259
2. This PR does the following: This PR migrates GitHub Action workflows to work under Docker. Currently we are not caching the docker build images which will be done as the future work. 
**NOTE: ** since currently both the docker setup and python setup are functional and due to this transition, the backend tests are failing for the scripts that are not useful in docker setup. refer [here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/actions/runs/6627385297/job/18002200792?pr=18999). Backend tests will be migrated under docker setup with the last PR #19049  where the python scripts will be deprecated that will not be useful after permanently moving to Docker.
3. (For bug-fixing PRs only) The original bug occurred because: [Explain what
   the cause of the bug was, and which PR introduced it]

## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The **PR title** starts with "Fix #bugnum: " or "Fix part of #bugnum: ...",
followed by a short, clear summary of the changes.
- [x] I have followed the [instructions for making a code change](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request).
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed on my local machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
- [x] My PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide).
- [x] I have assigned the correct reviewers to this PR (or will leave a
comment with the phrase "@{{reviewer_username}} PTAL" if I don't have
permissions to assign reviewers directly).

## Testing doc (for PRs with Beam jobs that modify production server data)

<!--
If this PR affects production server data, please follow
[these instructions](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Testing-jobs-and-other-features-on-production#submitting-a-pr-with-a-new-job-or-feature-that-requires-third-party-api)
and link to the job request doc here.

Otherwise, please delete this section.
-->
- [ ] A testing doc has been written: ... (ADD LINK) ...
- [ ] _(To be confirmed by the server admin)_ All jobs in this PR have been verified on a live server, and the PR is safe to merge.


## Proof that changes are correct

<!--
Add videos/screenshots of the user-facing interface to demonstrate that the changes
made in this PR work correctly. If this PR is for a developer-facing feature,
provide the videos/screenshots of developer-facing interface. Please also include
videos/screenshots of the developer tools browser console, so that we can be
sure that there are no console errors.

When you make updates to the PR, please update these videos/screenshots as well.
You can drop videos/screenshots from previous versions of the PR.

The above should be done for all PRs, including short ones (e.g. a single-line change).
However, if the changes in your PRs are autogenerated via a script and you cannot
provide proof for the changes then please leave a comment "No proof of changes
needed because {{Reason}}" and remove all the sections below.
-->

#### Proof of changes on desktop with slow/throttled network

<!--
Make sure to properly verify that everything works correctly, and that there are
no weird UI mistakes or other problems. Also, if there are any newly added fields,
try to fill them out and test that different inputs are correctly accepted/rejected.

Throttle the network (to 3G) using the browser Developer Tools (see references below).
There should be no performance or UI issues while the network is slow.

References:
 - Chrome: https://css-tricks.com/throttling-the-network/
 - Firefox: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Network_Monitor/Throttling
-->

#### Proof of changes on mobile phone

<!--
In some cases this is not needed (e.g. for pages that we do not expect to
support mobile phones, or for backend-only features).

Feel free to use the Developer Tools emulator for this.

References:
 - Chrome: https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/device-mode/
 - Firefox: https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/devtools-user/index.html#responsive-design-mode
-->

#### Proof of changes in Arabic language

<!--
If the PR changes the UI, make sure to add screenshots with the site
language set to Arabic as well (we use Arabic as it is a language written from right to left).
-->

## PR Pointers

- Never force push! If you do, your PR will be closed.
- To reply to reviewers, follow these instructions: https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request#step-5-address-review-comments-until-all-reviewers-approve
- Some e2e tests are flaky, and can fail for reasons unrelated to your PR. We are working on fixing this, but in the meantime, if you need to restart the tests, please check the ["If your build fails" wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/If-CI-checks-fail-on-your-PR).
- See the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia's-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers) for what code owners will expect.

'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1377376759, 'comment_body': 'I am starting angular-build container independently at first so that it can create the node_modules volume since it is a fresh build. the reason for doing this because we faced an issue during M1 that for the fresh build we cannot start all the containers all at the same time otherwise it will stuck for infinitely. workaround for this is to firstly start the angular-build container to create the node_modules volume which takes the most space, and afterwards start all the other containers', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 31, 10, 31, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1377377793, 'comment_body': 'we are running the tests in dev 'Shivkant-Chauhan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1377380711, 'comment_body': 'consider it as optimisation, we can do the same using make run-devserver command, but this command takes more time since it waits for the server to start completely. it is not required here since we again start the server with the make run_tests.e2e, so it is not starting the server here and saves us around 7mins on CI. please refer [here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/18999#discussion_r1377376759) for why we need to strt the angular build container at first', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023,
